label: A2B5_cF392_216_4efg_4ef4h-001
title: Pt$_{3}$Zn$_{10}$ Structure
comments:
The site occupation in this structure is rather complicated: \begin{itemize} \item In any unit cell, only one of the Pt-II/Zn-II sites is occupied. \item The site we have labeled Pt-II is actually 50\% platinum and 50\% zinc. \item The sites we have labeled Zn-II and Zn-V are 8.333\% platinum and 91.667\% zinc. \item The Pt-V and Pt-VI sites are 2/3 platinum and 1/3 zinc. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Accounting for all of this the nominal composition of the structure is approximately Pt$_{3}$Zn$_{10}$. 
 This is an example of an F-cell $\gamma$-brass. (Mizutani, 2010) 
 (Johansson, 1970) give the Wyckoff positions of the (24h) sites as $x y y$.  The standard representation, used by AFLOW, is $x x y$, so we have swapped their $x$ and $y$ coordinates for these sites.
